text:
There are two valid return values from WaitForSingleObject() which indicate that
a mutex object was successfully obtained, WAIT_OBJECT_0 and WAIT_ABANDONED. 
WAIT_ABANDONED is not being handled appropriately in
httpd-2.0.53/srclib/apr/locks/win32/thread_cond.c, i.e., the thread may never
release the mutex, which can result in other threads remaining blocked.
creator: harvey.eneman@oracle.com
chip@force-elite.com
text: *** Bug 34338 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

creator: mturk@apache.org
text:
We are waiting on the Event object. WAIT_ABANDONED can be returned
only with the Mutex objects according to the MSDN.
APR HEAD has a fixed thread_cond, so it may require to backport the
patch to the 0.9.x branch.

creator: harvey.eneman@oracle.com
text:
In revision 224407 of /apr/apr/trunk/locks/win32/thread_cond.c (July 22nd 2005),
the direct use of the WaiteForSingleObject() on a mutex object was removed as
part of the resolution of bug 27654.  These distinct bugs can be resolved by
using the same backported patch but this isn't necessarily a hard dependency.

creator: henryjen@ztune.net
text: This should had been fixed as part of issue 27654's fix.
